original: EKLUND, Sven Olof Viktor, Bergsingenjör, Nora, f Örebro 20/2 94 av fabr B D A E o Hanna Svensson, gm Anna-Greta Carild. Real-studex öbr 13, bergsingex KTH 22. Fänr v Göta art.reg 15, ex AIHS, löjtn 18, övergång res 19, avsk 31. Prakt o arb i Sv 21—22: Jernkont :s stip i Tyskl, Österr o Frankr i* bergverkstekn frågor 22—23; driftsled v Ge~ werkschaft Dirstentritt Tyrolen Österr samt statl legitim bergvksled i Österr 23—26; dok-torserkänn i Österr 25; led fabr- o aff.verksamh Örebro 26—27; gruving o geolog i Westfalen 27—28; prospektor o malnigeol på Sumatra 29—30; ass manager v bergvkt Mangani, MM Aequator, Sumatra, 30—^32; e. o. statstjman i Bergstaten sanit tjg å Komm.koll^ bergsbyrå 32; malmundersökn KTH samt konsult uppdr f Boliden, tjg h Soc.styr o legitim gruvmät 33; malmgeol o gruving v danska exp t östgrönland 33—35, undersökn åt danska staten v försöksbrytn å Agpatön 35, anlade brottet 36. Driftsbestyrer h Grönlands Styrelse 37—39, gruving v V:a Berg-mästaredistr 39, tf bergmäst i S:a o V:a distrv fi tillf, konsult uppdr f sv gruvor o mo-lybdengr Knaben, Norge. Av trycket: De jonge Diabasen Sumatras (tills m de Haan i tidskr De Mijningenieur, Haag 30), Guldsilverbergsbruket i v:a Sumatra (Tekn Tidskr 33), Om den malmgeol forskn på östgrönl (ibid 35), Marmorbrytn på Nordvästgrönl etc (ibid 40). Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: EKLUND, Sven Olof Viktor, Mining Engineer, Nora, b. Örebro 20/2 1894, son of factory worker B D A E and Hanna Svensson, m. Anna-Greta Carild. Studied at Örebro Real School until age 13, then studied mining engineering at the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) until 1922. Commissioned as Second Lieutenant in the Göta Artillery Regiment in 1915, graduated from the Army Industrial College (AIHS), promoted to Lieutenant in 1918, transferred to the reserves in 1919, discharged in 1931. Worked in various practical and professional positions in Sweden between 1921 and 1932: Jernkontorets scholarship in Germany, Austria, and France for mining engineering matters (1922-1923); superintendent at Ge- werkschaft Dirstentritt in Tyrol, Austria, and state-licensed mining superintendent in Austria (1923-1926); recognized as a doctor in Austria (1925); involved in factory and business activities in Örebro (1926-1927); mining and geological work in Westphalia (1927-1928); prospector and ore geologist in Sumatra (1929-1930); assistant manager of Mangani Mining Company, MM Aequator, Sumatra (1930-1932); temporary government official at the Mining State Office, responsible for health at the Mining Inspection Bureau (1932); ore investigation at KTH and consultant tasks for Boliden, serving on the Social Board and holding a legitimate mining surveyor position (1933); ore geologist and mining work for Danish expeditions in East Greenland (1933-1935); investigations commissioned by the Danish government on trial mining at Agpatön (1935), overseeing the establishment of the mine in 1936. Manager of operations at the Greenland Board from 1937 to 1939, mining in the Western Chief Inspectorate District in 1939, acting chief mining inspector in Southern and Western districts on a temporary basis, consulting for Swedish mines and molybdenum mines in Knaben, Norway. Published works include: "The Young Diabases of Sumatra" (in collaboration with de Haan in the journal De Mijningenieur, The Hague, 1930), "Gold-Silver Mine in Western Sumatra" (Teknisk Tidskrift, 1933), "On the Ore Geological Research in East Greenland" (ibid, 1935), "Marble Quarrying in Northwest Greenland" (ibid, 1940). Member of the Swedish Society of Engineers.

works.name: On the Ore Geological Research in East Greenland
